1.text: And Bildad the Shuhite answereth and saith:—

2.text: Till when dost thou speak these things? And a strong wind—sayings of thy mouth?

3.text: Doth God pervert judgment? And doth the Mighty One pervert justice?

4.text: If thy sons have sinned before Him, And He doth send them away, By the hand of their transgression,

5.text: If thou dost seek early unto God, And unto the Mighty makest supplication,

6.text: If pure and upright thou art, Surely now He waketh for thee, And hath completed The habitation of thy righteousness.

7.text: And thy beginning hath been small, And thy latter end is very great.

8.text: For, ask I pray thee of a former generation, And prepare to a search of their fathers,

9.text: (For of yesterday we are, and we know not, For a shadow are our days on earth.)

10.text: Do they not shew thee—speak to thee, And from their heart bring forth words?

11.text: ‘Doth a rush wise without mire? A reed increase without water?

12.text: While it is in its budding—uncropped, Even before any herb it withereth.

13.text: So are the paths of all forgetting God, And the hope of the profane doth perish,

14.text: Whose confidence is loathsome, And the house of a spider his trust.

15.text: He leaneth on his house—and it standeth not: He taketh hold on it—and it abideth not.

16.text: Green he is before the sun, And over his garden his branch goeth out.

17.text: By a heap his roots are wrapped, A house of stones he looketh for.

18.text: If one doth destroy him from his place, Then it hath feigned concerning him, I have not seen thee!

19.text: Lo, this is the joy of his way, And from the dust others spring up.’

20.text: Lo, God doth not reject the perfect, Nor taketh hold on the hand of evil doers.

21.text: While he filleth with laughter thy mouth, And thy lips with shouting,

22.text: Those hating thee do put on shame, And the tent of the wicked is not!
